alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 9:01PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Carson and northwestern Gray Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 901 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of White Deer to 4 miles south of Kingsmill. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pampa, White Deer, Skellytown and Kingsmill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
